brief.content-text: The diagram depicts WAN devices. A network cloud labeled WAN contains two WAN switches connected to four interconnected core routers. One PC is connected to a DSL modem and then to a WAN switch via the PSTN. Another PC is connected to a cable modem. The cable modem is then connected to a WAN switch via the cable network. The WAN switch is connected to a channel service unit / data service unit (CSU/DSU) via a T1 dedicated, leased line. The CSU/DSU is then connected to a router. Three PC's are each connected to a modem. The modems are then connected to a WAN switch via an access server.
